tooltips.text_pattern:
The pattern may contain * to denote any text and ? to denote any single character.

For example:
*abc* - means any description containing abc,
ab*cd - means any description starting with ab and ending with cd,
?abc - means a description starting with any character followed by abc,
abc - means a description equal to abc.

Patterns are case-insensitive. For example, abc matches abc as well as ABC or aBc.

operations.ConsoleLock_desc: Locks the computer (the console session) and turns the monitor off.
operations.Sleep_desc: Enters the computer into the sleep state (S1, S2 or S3 ACPI state). The machine state (logged in users, running applications) remains in RAM, which forces the computer's basic systems to be constantly powered. On the other hand, waking up from this state takes the least amount of time.
operations.Sleep_descwarning: Note: if the target computer doesn't support the sleep state, Statlook will attempt to hibernate the computer.
operations.Hibernation_desc: Enters the computer into the hibernate state (S4 ACPI state). In this mode, the computer consumes (depending on the architecture) the same or slightly more energy than in the shutdown state. The machine state (logged in users, running applications) is saved to disk. After waking up, the machine state is restored from disk and thus unsaved data is not lost.
operations.Hibernation_descwarning: Note: if the target computer doesn't support the hibernation state, Statlook will attempt to put the computer into the sleep state.
operations.Shutdown_desc: Enters the computer into the shutdown state (S5 ACPI state). In this mode, the computer consumes the least amount of energy. The machine state is not saved, therefore waking up from this state means a full boot of the operating system. To avoid data loss, this operation is not executed if there are locked sessions on the computer.
operations.ForcedShutdown_desc: Enters the computer into the shutdown state (S5 ACPI state). In this mode, the computer consumes the least amount of energy. The machine state is not saved, therefore waking up from this state means a full boot of the operating system.
operations.ForcedShutdown_descwarning: Warning: this operation forcibly logs off the locked sessions. This may result in a loss of unsaved data.

Warning: The activation will send an email to the user with the link to activate the account. The user should click the activation link in the received message, and then define his login and password.

Users that do not have an active account can log on to the Statlook Web using the Statlook Assistant.
messages.multiple_filters_message_users: If you create more than one filter, you will make the edited rights apply only to those users who meet the conditions specified in all filters. If you want to define rights for users meeting the conditions of one or another filter, create two user rights pages (Add new rights button) and define those filters on separate pages.
messages.multiple_filters_message_inventory: If you create more than one filter, you will make the edited rights apply only to those inventory items which meet the conditions specified in all filters. If you want to define rights for inventory items meeting the conditions of one or another filter, create two inventory rights pages (Add new rights button) and define those filters on separate pages.
messages.multiple_filters_message_licenses: If you create more than one filter, you will make the edited rights apply only to those licenses which meet the conditions specified in all filters. If you want to define rights for licenses meeting the conditions of one or another filter, create two license rights pages (Add new rights button) and define those filters on separate pages.

Title.desc_1_d: Handy online access from anywhere for all users
Title.desc_2_e_2: all user actions on the timeline
Title.desc_3_b: Choose a hotpoint of your interest to find out more.

MenuHeader.desc_1_1: The main menu allows for quick switching between system modules.
MenuHeader.desc_1_2: The number of modules depends on your license and system rights.
MenuHeader.desc_2_1: Use this menu to check the latest notifications generated by the system.
MenuHeader.desc_2_2: In settings you can manage helpdesk permissions and administrative accounts.
MenuHeader.desc_2_3: The user menu allows you to change the password, and log off the system.
MenuHeader.desc_3_1: Quick Add allows you to create a user, resource, or issue without a need to change modules.
MenuHeader.desc_3_2: Immediately after creating an item, you can access its properties.

Dashboard.desc_1_1: Dashboard is a place where widgets display selected statistics from the system.
Dashboard.desc_1_2: You can customize the tile layout by dragging them to other places.

AccordionList.desc_1_1: The resource tree allows you to search the context so that you do not need to type the whole word to find the resource you're looking for.
AccordionList.desc_1_2: By marking the entire branch in the tree, all the resources belonging to the branch will be displayed.

Grid.desc_1_1: Single click opens a user or resource card.

Filters.desc_1_1: By using filters, you can customize the number of results displayed and their form.

Views.desc_1_1: Views you can create in the desktop Master console will also be available in the Statlook Web.

ItemCard.desc_1_1: An Information Card is a place where information about a particular record is displayed.
ItemCard.desc_1_2: Switch between bookmarks to see what you can find here.
ItemCard.desc_1_3: To edit the data you just need to select one of the fields, enter a new value, and you save the changes clicking in the upper right corner.
ItemCard.desc_1_4: Using the arrow in the upper left corner you can change the view from short to full
ItemCard.desc_1_4_ext: (try changing the view of a User Activity tab)

UserActivityExtended.desc_1_1: Timeline - click any time span marked blue.
UserActivityExtended.desc_1_2: Blue indicates that employee's activity was recorded.
UserActivityExtended.desc_1_3: The data gathered shows, among other, the programs used and the websites visited at the time.

TimeTracking.desc_1_1: Automated timekeeping allows you to gather information about how long you have been involved in handling this request.

Notes.desc_1_1: Several people working on one application? Or maybe you can not finish it now?
Notes.desc_1_2: Do not let the solution disappear in the rush of other things, write them down as a note, and be sure to come back to report you will remember what has been done.

dashboard.header_1: Access to data set / Data set access changes
dashboard.desc_1_1: In this section you may request the access to a given dataset or entrust the data to an external company.
dashboard.desc_1_2: This kind of request may be applied by any person from your enterprise. Next, it is directed to a Data Protection Officer, and later – to the Personal Data Controller, who would accept the request and forward it to a completion. A request which is already dealt with will generate a record within „Access” or „Entrusting” registers.
dashboard.desc_1_3: The other request serves for changing or cancelling the access or entrusting permissions which are already created. The process is similar to the access/entrusting request.

itemCard.desc_1_1: Before you proceed with allocating access and entrusting the data sets, make sure that:
itemCard.desc_1_5_c: were created – including Personal Data Controller and the deliverers of services (Organization - Master)

dashboard.desc_1_1: In art. 30 GDPR there is a description of how to keep a properly-managed Register of Processing Operations. All of these functionalities can be found within the following three registers (Data sets / Processing Operations, Access and Entrusting)
dashboard.desc_1_2: All of the demanded pieces of information are recorded within these reports. They might be easily shared on a demand of supervisory authority or during a controlling procedure.
dashboard.desc_1_3: It is not obligatory for certain groups to keep such records. Yet, they provide you with a strong asset in case your company undergoes a controlling procedure carried out by the national supervisory authority.

itemCard.desc_1_1: Before you proceed with creating data sets, make sure that:
itemCard.desc_1_4_c: were created – including Personal Data Controller and the deliverers of services (Organization - Master)

Breach.desc_1_1: Each issue which may jeopardize data security is reported via this section.
Breach.desc_1_2: Solving this kind of issue, and ensuring the safety of the data, within 72 hours allows you to omit the necessity of reporting the breach to a supervisory authority (art. 33 GDPR)
Breach.desc_1_3: Remember – GDPR underlines the necessity of reporting the data breach to a person whose data are endangered – but only in certain cases (art. 33 GDPR)

Deletion.desc_1_1: ‘Right to be forgotten’ is ensured within art. 17 GDPR – thus, this option allows you to report all of the requests concerning the data governed by your organization.
Deletion.desc_1_2: Remember – data can be deleted only if there is no necessity of storing them anymore.
Deletion.desc_1_3: Data which ceased to be processed should be deleted on an ongoing basis.

Documents.desc_1_1: A repository of all of the documents concerning personal data security is an invaluable base of knowledge both for employees and experts responsible for safety of the data.
Documents.desc_1_2: By assigning the documents to departments you may easily limit their accessibility and adjust their content to the receivers.

Processing.desc_1_1: Depending on your role within your company, different statuses will be the point of your interest:
Processing.desc_1_5: The statistics and the pie chart displayed below will inform you about the number of the requests on a regular basis.

Trainings.desc_1_1: According to art. 39 GDPR , your Personal Data Controller is appointed to take care about training the staff who take part in processing personal data. This module serves the purpose of planning those trainings – either for employees or for management members.
